intro: Phaenopyrum corallinum, commonly known as the coral tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its distinctive coral-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, which bloom in clusters along the branches. Phaenopyrum corallinum is a deciduous shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats.
